config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'skipUpscaling' is a boolean option that determines whether to skip upscaling images during the image processing. If the option is selected (true), the program will skip the upscaling process for images. If the option is not selected (false), the program will perform upscaling as required.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'skipUpscaling' configuration depends on the user's choice when running the image processing program. If the user selects the option to skip upscaling, the configuration will be triggered every time an image processing task is performed. If the user does not select the option, the configuration will not be triggered.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'skipUpscaling' configuration option on the system is that it can potentially save processing time and resources by skipping the upscaling process for images. However, this may result in lower quality images if upscaling is necessary for certain images. The decision to enable or disable this configuration option should be based on the specific requirements of the image processing tasks.
